sentences.en: ‘She’s a lot older than you, isn’t she?’ ‘Fifteen years, to be precise .’
sentences.cn: “她比你大很多，是不是？”“准确地说，大了15岁。”

sentences.en: A scientist must be precise in making tests.
sentences.cn: 科学家做试验必须精确.

sentences.en: At that precise moment, Miss Pulteney came into the office.
sentences.cn: 就在那时, 普尔特尼小姐走进了办公室.

sentences.en: At the precise moment that I put my foot on the step, the bus started.
sentences.cn: 恰好就在我登上公共汽车台阶的时候, 车开动了.

sentences.en: Can you give a more precise definition of the word?
sentences.cn: 你能给这个词下个更确切的定义吗？

sentences.en: Elgar supplied his works with precise indications of tempo.
sentences.cn: 埃尔加给自己的作品标上了精确的节奏标记。

sentences.en: He is especially emphatic about the value of a precise routine.
sentences.cn: 他特别强调严格按程序走的意义。

sentences.en: He is precise and mildly donnish in manner.
sentences.cn: 他一丝不苟，带着几分学究气。
他在一切方面都太仔细了.

sentences.en: It is written in a detached, precise style.
sentences.cn: 行文冷静客观，一针见血。

sentences.en: It was difficult to get precise information.
She gave me clear and precise directions.
sentences.cn: 她给了我清晰而准确的指示。

sentences.en: The confession was not a precise record taken down contemporaneously during the interview.
sentences.cn: 这份告白并非采访期间同期记录下来的一份一字不差的东西。

sentences.en: The precise details of the origins of life remain hidden.
sentences.cn: 生命起源的确切详情仍是个谜。

sentences.en: The precise location of the wreck was discovered in 1988.
sentences.cn: 残骸的确切位置是在1988年发现的。

sentences.en: there were not many—five, to be precise.
sentences.cn: 数量不多—准确地说，只有五个。

sentences.en: These precise instruments have already gone into mass production.
sentences.cn: 这些精密仪器已经大规模投入生产.
他们讲一口非常地道的英语。

words.tran_cn: 精度，[数] 精密度；精确

phrases.tran_cn: 精密星历表；精确星历表

trans.tran_cn: 清晰的，精确的，正规的，精密
trans.tran_en: precise information, details etc are exact, clear, and correct
